greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of intersecting set systems with empty intersection (meaning there is no vertex in common to all the edges) covering n vertices.
comment: Covering means there are no isolated vertices. A set system (set of sets) is intersecting if no two edges are disjoint.
formula: Inverse binomial transform of A326373. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Aug 12 2019
example: The a(3) = 2 intersecting set systems with empty intersection:
xref: Covering set systems with empty intersection are A318128.
Covering, intersecting set systems are A305843.
Covering, intersecting antichains with empty intersection are A326365.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Jul 01 2019
